Content: 3 *p39883a0320* turn over     answer all questions. 1 many fruits contain vitamin c.  fruits can decay quickly when stored at room  temperature.  they are therefore sometimes stored in a refrigerator or freezer.   (a) describe an experiment to investigate the effect of storage temperature on the  vitamin c content of one type of fruit. (5)                     pmt

4 *p39883a0420*   (b) (i) state two variables which need to be controlled in this investigation. (2)         (ii) choose one of the variables from (b)(i) above.  suggest how this variable can  be controlled.  describe what effect it could have on the results if it is not  controlled. (2) variable   how to control the variable      effect on the results if the variable is not controlled       pmt
5 *p39883a0520* turn over       (c) suggest why storing fruit at low temperature slows down decay. (3)          (total for question 1 = 12 marks) pmt

6 *p39883a0620* 2 a student decided to investigate the effect of listening to music on short-term  memory.   she recorded how many numbers were correctly recalled from a grid containing 25  random numbers.  she tested 15 members of her class (students a to o) with no  music.  she repeated the test three times for each student and calculated the mean  for each student.   she repeated the tests with the same 15 students, while they listened to some loud  music.   a copy of her mean results for each student is shown below:   no music:   a 10.3,  b 9.7,  c 10.0,  d 11.7,  e 11.7,  f 11.3,  g 10.7,  h 10.3,    i 12.3,  j 11.3,  k 10.7,  l 10.3,  m 11.3,  n 11.0,  o 11.0   with music:   a 9.0,  b 10.3,  c 10.7,  d 10.3,  e 9.7,  f 11.0,  g 9.3,  h 10.7,    i 10.3,  j 9.7,  k 10.0,  l 10.3,  m 9.7,  n 11.0,  o 9.7   (a) write a suitable null hypothesis for this investigation. (1)    pmt

7 *p39883a0720* turn over       (b) prepare a suitable table to display the data obtained and calculate the overall  mean for the numbers recalled by these 15 students, both with music and with no  music. (4) pmt

9 *p39883a0920* turn over       (c) on the graph paper below, draw a suitable graph to show the effect of listening  to music on the overall mean for the numbers recalled by these students.  include  on your graph an indication of the variability in the overall means. (3) pmt

10 *p39883a01020*   (d) the student applied a t-test to explore the significance of her results.     she obtained a result of t = 3.30 from her calculation.     the table below shows some critical values for t-test calculations. degrees of freedom significance level (p) 0.05 0.01 14 2.14 2.98 15 2.13 2.94 16 2.12 2.92 17 2.11 2.90 18 2.10 2.88 19 2.09 2.86 20 2.09 2.85 21 2.08 2.83 22 2.07 2.82 23 2.07 2.81 24 2.06 2.80 25 2.06 2.80 30 2.04 2.75   1.96 2.58 pmt

(5)               (e) suggest why it may not be reasonable to draw a valid conclusion from the results   of this investigation. (3)       (total for question 2 = 16 marks) pmt

12 *p39883a01220* 3 a company is in the process of developing a new stain-removing washing liquid.   they want to include a protease enzyme to digest the proteins that are responsible  for some stains on clothes.   plan an investigation to discover the optimum concentration of protease to use in  this new stain-removing washing liquid.   your answer should give details under the following headings.   (a) a consideration of whether there are any safety or ethical issues. (2)            pmt
13 *p39883a01320* turn over       (b) suggestions for preliminary work that you might undertake to ensure your  proposed method would provide meaningful data. (3)           pmt
